plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ‚å®Ô∏è View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. üñåÔ∏è Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. üåÖ Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. üé® Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. üåê Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ‚úÖ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. üñºÔ∏è List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. üåÉ Dark mode support.

plugins.name: QQT Random Number Generator
plugins.description:
This is a Figma plugin that replaces selected text with randomly generated numbers. It supports both Chinese and English language interfaces, has a clear visual hierarchy, and is simple and intuitive to operate.

Functional Features

1. Range Setting: You can set the minimum and maximum values of the random numbers (e.g., 20 - 50).

2. Decimal Place Setting: You can set the number of digits after the decimal point.

3. Thousand Separator Display: You can choose whether to insert a thousand separator in the number.

4. Custom Prefix and Suffix: You can add custom prefixes and suffixes, such as +, -, %, HKD, ¬•, etc.

5. Chinese - English Switch: It supports quick switching between Chinese and English interfaces.

plugins.name: Long side scaling
plugins.description:
Tired of manually resizing images within frames one by one, especially when you need them to fit a specific maximum dimension while keeping their aspect ratio? "Long Side Scaling" automates this task!


What this plugin does:

  1. It finds the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill inside each selected Frame.
  2. It takes the dimension you provide (e.g., 1040px).
  3. It identifies whether the image's width or height is larger (the "longest side").
  4. It then proportionally resizes the image so that its longest side exactly matches the dimension you entered.


How to use:

  1. Select one or more Frames containing the images you want to resize.
  2. Run the "Long Side Scaling" plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. The plugin window will show how many selected frames contain a suitable image.
  4. Enter the desired dimension (in pixels) for the longest side into the input field.
  5. Click the "Start" button.
  6. The images within the selected frames will be resized instantly!


Key Benefits:

  1. Batch Processing: Saves time by resizing images in multiple frames at once.
  2. Proportional Scaling: Guarantees your images won't be stretched or distorted.
  3. Consistent Sizing: Perfect for creating uniform image galleries, grids, or ensuring images don't exceed a maximum width or height.
  4. Simple Interface: Easy to use with just one input and one button.


Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
plugins.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

  4. Enter the desired dimension (in pixels) for the longest side into the input field.
  5. Click the "Start" button.
  6. The images within the selected frames will be resized instantly!


Key Benefits:

  1. Batch Processing: Saves time by resizing images in multiple frames at once.
  2. Proportional Scaling: Guarantees your images won't be stretched or distorted.
  3. Consistent Sizing: Perfect for creating uniform image galleries, grids, or ensuring images don't exceed a maximum width or height.
  4. Simple Interface: Easy to use with just one input and one button.


Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
130386.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

plugins.name: ‰∏ÄÈîÆÁøªËØëÂÖÉÁ¥† Quick Translate
plugins.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

137614.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

plugins.name: Rename by text list
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.

plugins.name: Tiny Exports
plugins.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma‚Äôs export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) ‚Äì available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers


How to Use

  1. Set Figma‚Äôs export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin‚Äôs Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) ‚Äì 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf ‚Äì jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues

- Unable to export and set multiple exports from one layer
plugins.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

plugins.name: Human Design Map Builder
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (◊û◊§◊ï◊™ ◊û◊¢◊ï◊ì◊õ◊†◊ï◊™) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
plugins.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

135215.name: Zephyr Export
135215.description: Exports a section with all its images as an atlas to the Defold engine. Before exporting, it wraps images into frames, all existing frames into components, adds TYPE TYPE_BOX property to all components and sets constraints scale (scale is not set if stretch is set). After that you can use your components in the zephyr plugin

plugins.name: Kobalt Copilot
plugins.description: Analyze your marketing designs for compliance risks without leaving Figma. Simply select a frame, hit analyze, and instantly receive risk assessments from Kobalt's marketing compliance tool. Identify potential regulatory issues early in your design process and create compliant marketing materials with confidence. Note: You need a subscription to Kobalt Copilot (www.kobaltlabs.com) to run analyses.
plugins.tagline: Marketing compliance risk review

plugins.name: JSON to Variable
plugins.description:
You can import a JSON file to create grouped Figma variables. you can download the pre-structured Tailwind color palette JSON file via the link as a starting point:


Tailwind colors structured.json


The following is an example of a correctly formatted JSON:

[
{
"CollectionName": {
"modes": {
"ModeName": {
"GroupName": {
"Primary": {
"$value": "#FFFFFF",
"$type": "color"
},

"secondary": {
"$value": "#F5F5F5",
"$type": "color"
}
},
"GroupName2": {
"primary": {
"$value": "#2196F3",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}
}
}
]
plugins.tagline: Import JSON file to variable
